column4: when I have all the effects on with my nvidia geforce ti 4200, I cant see the top menu bar with the minimize and exit buttons on it, and my terminal is completely white
is your monitor refresh/resolution right?
did you put that in your xorg conf after looking at your manual to what specifics it is?
yeah it worked fine until I rebotoed my computer, I dont quite follow you on your last comment

Ok as I remember it been a while, to properly setup your xorg and make drivers optimal you need to put in the Refresh mhz rate in the xorg.conf file to match your monitor otherwise its some generic one
some sizes aren't support and with mhz refresh off it won't line up edge to edge right is what I'm saying
that is listed in your users manual or found on our monitor website after some digging
sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf
that will get you in your xorg config file.. go to the bottom where it talks about what Resolutions/refresh for your monitor and out it in there..
looking for this Section "Monitor"
I'll be doing something along that line in a day or two when I'm done ripping my music I'm going to get my video properly working and setup my dual monitors
it work ok and you get into gui?
go to the Display manager and resize your desktop then do the "Auto Adjust" on your monitor
System > Administration > Screen and Graphics
what resolution/depth you have it on?
Refresh rate?
change it in there to 60, and then "Auto Adjust" on your monitor
it won't let me change it to 60, and it doesn't say auto anything anywhere
right about it under Monitor, try to find yours in the list maybe that will help if not then I'm not sure :S your xorg.conf is properly setup..
as I said its been a while and sorry I couldn't help more
np hope someone else can help you with that
